title: Rounded poster face on cover of Wired magazine
content:
This font has been making the rounds lately on magazine covers and unfotunately all I can find on the web is a very small preview. Not much to work with, I know.

[http://a1112.g.akamai.net/7/1112/492/20040528/www.wired.com/wired/covers...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013172807/http:/a1112.g.akamai.net/7/1112/492/20040528/www.wired.com/wired/covers/cover13_06.jpg "http://a1112.g.akamai.net/7/1112/492/20040528/www.wired.com/wired/covers/cover13\_06.jpg")

It’s a black condensed helvetica with very slight rounded corners.

Any idea what it is?

 [‹ Anyone know this gem V1.1?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013172807/http:/typophile.com/node/13476 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Renu Herbs logo - Mirarae {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013172807/http:/typophile.com/node/13480 "Go to next forum topic")
author: timpedersen

comments.content:
If you want a beautiful black condensed grotesque with rounded corners, why don’t you check [Peter Bruhn](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013172807/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Peter%252BBruhn)’s delicious [Ketchupa](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013172807/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/ketchupa.asp), also available bundled with [Mustardo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013172807/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/mustardo.asp) and [Mayo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013172807/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/mayo.asp) in the Imbiss [Package](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013172807/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/imbisspackage.asp).

_BTW These fonts are also available through your local FontShop._
